body_html:
@peterjc123 Ok, but how exactly during the build process is NativeFunctionsCuda.cu supposed to find NativeFunctions.h? If you open up NativeFunctionsCuda.cu, the very first line of the file is #include "ATen/NativeFunctions.h", however, the ATen directory does not contain NativeFunctions.h (it is in ATen/Templates), so to me, it seems correct that it throws

pytorch/aten/src/ATen/native/cuda/NativeFunctionsCuda.cu(1): fatal error C1083: Cannot open include file: 'ATen/NativeFunctions.h': No such file or directory

Looking at the raw build commands in the output, there doesn't seem to be any -I"\some\dir" directive which points the nvcc compiler to NativeFunctions.h during building of NativeFunctionsCuda.cu.

I do agree that NativeFunctions.h has no real C code inside, which means there must be a pre-processing step somewhere earlier in the process which populates the templates and copies them to the correct location? Can you please point out where/how this is supposed to happen in the build process? It would help to find it and try to figure out why it is not working correctly for certain users.

body:
@peterjc123 Ok, but how exactly during the build process is NativeFunctionsCuda.cu supposed to find NativeFunctions.h? If you open up NativeFunctionsCuda.cu, the very first line of the file is #include "ATen/NativeFunctions.h", however, the ATen directory does not contain NativeFunctions.h (it is in ATen/Templates), so to me, it seems correct that it throws

`pytorch/aten/src/ATen/native/cuda/NativeFunctionsCuda.cu(1): fatal error C1083: Cannot open include file: 'ATen/NativeFunctions.h': No such file or directory
`

Looking at the raw build commands in the output, there doesn't seem to be any -I"\some\dir" directive which points the nvcc compiler to NativeFunctions.h during building of NativeFunctionsCuda.cu.

I do agree that NativeFunctions.h has no real C code inside, which means there must be a pre-processing step somewhere earlier in the process which populates the templates and copies them to the correct location? Can you please point out where/how this is supposed to happen in the build process? It would help to find it and try to figure out why it is not working correctly for certain users.
